choice.content: A. make sitting in it much better
B. teach us how to avoid some of the mistakes we often make
C. avoid merging from one lane to the other
D. avoid ruining our day in a traffic jam

questions.question: 2. “Chances are good that you’re doing it wrong” in paragraph 2 means that ______.

choice.content: A. you need to wait for good chances to merge
B. merging from lane to lane is always wrong
C. you have good chances to avoid making mistakes
D. you are likely to do it wrong

questions.question: 1. There is no reason why a gifted aircraft designer should also be a capable pilot. In the same way, a brilliant pilot can be a menace .
2. The work would have been inconceivable before the .

1. There’s a lot of interesting science behind traffic, though, and while understanding it might not make sitting in it any better, it can teach you how to avoid some of the mistakes we all make behind the wheel. (para. 1)
questions.answer: 交通背后也有很多有趣的知识。虽然知道这些可能不会使情况有所好转，但却能教会你如何避免开车时所犯的种种错误。

questions.question: 2. If you do that, traffic will fall into a more natural pattern called a “zipper merge”,    meaning there are no surprises, no sudden braking, and a smoother transition from one lane to another, which cuts down on backups. (para. 3)
questions.answer: 这样一来，交通就会呈现出一种更加自然、称为“拉链式并道”的模式，也就是说，不会吓人一跳，没有突然刹车，而是平稳地从一车道并入另一车道，这样就会减少拥堵。
